20.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 janvier 2021
Wreszcie Dungeon Crawler na jaki długo czekałem. Niby wszystkie punkty gatunku zaliczone ale jednak w nowoczesnej formie, przy okazji lekko rozwijając już stary gatunek. Nie mamy jak w typowym crawlerze kilkunastu poziomów jeden za drugim bez możliwości lub potrzeby powrotu na poprzednie poziomy. Dużą ilość sekretów na mapach idzie odkryć tylko poprzez zdobycie pewnych artefaktów w późniejszych etapach gry a potem powrót na poprzednie mapy. Fabuła w miarę poprawna i przyjemna, zakończenie sugeruje kolejną część (choć to wiadomo że zależy od sprzedaży) Rozwój postaci i towarzysze też poprawnie - każdy zapewnia inny gameplay i zestaw umiejętności.
 
heolaerialis
397 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
32.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2020
I want to counter all naysayers who complain about the following things

1) No consumables in game, yes the consumables are not there instead you get limited use spells. I find that rather good design because in most games I tend to hoard and or farm consumables for the rainy day...and never use them anyway. Here they are limited use spells each character has only 1 slot so tough choices. And potions are not cluttering my inventory!

2) Respecing character stats and spells at will. I read lots of complaints about this too in many reviews. This seemed in the beginning very strange but this feature is actually integral part of the game. You just NEED to do it constantly to succeed so this is a part of the game. Otherwise some encounters already in the beginning would be very very frustrating. Later you can swap party members but in the beginning you have no other choice. I am enjoying tinkering my party members and changing their focus.

3) Complaints about puzzles. I find puzzles entertaining with some neat ideas and fun special tools. And it is hilarious how party members comment the actions of the protagonist.

All in all It is a fun little game with unique Hungarian lore, so you will hear genuine Hungarian names:)
 
mudakonn

The story presentation is very fairy tale like and the subtle Hungarian mythology elements gives the world of Operencia quite its uniqueness. I especially liked to listen to the character conversations around the campfire. Regarding the gameplay, Operencia revolves around exploring and puzzle solving and fighting with the fights being turn based where one can come up with nice combos from the skills of any of the four selected characters. All in all, I would recommed it to any fantasy rpg fan.

I'm a new VR player and love turn based games, so this is a gem in my opinion. Puzzles, hidden chests and strategic combat gives this game a good combination of fun. Movement is a bit clunky as you follow a grid but you easily adapt to it. Levels of difficulty keep you on your feet and rethink strategy when you are defeated. Good amount of loot and levelling up characters gives you a good amount of options on how you want the to support the party.

Шикарный данжион-краулер! Олдскул и всё такое. Конечно качество перевода на русский язык иногда заметно прихрамывает, но это не мешает погрузиться в игру. Особенно если играть в VR. bob0
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2020
The UI and experience are absolutely awful in VR. Opening cutscenes don't make it clear which way "forward" is, which is disorienting. Spawns a Windows Firewall prompt that can only be answered on desktop, which resulted in a glitchy pause screen over the opening (with sound effects) that I was _about_ to ctrl+alt+del out of as a softlock, before it sort of recovered itself. Opening dialog alternates between subtitled and not-subtitled. The game does not make it clear when you're frozen in place for a cutscene vs. when you aren't. Party members are invisible voices in your head. No debuff icons.

No indication which party member an attack hit, unless you're specifically watching the turn order meter instead of the combat visual effects. Action prompts are not reliable. Enemy status text is Z-ordered in front of the enemy even when the enemy model geometrically occludes it, which is a bad and headache-inducing look in VR.

A turn-based grid-based game in VR will always feel a little odd; that's okay, it's something of a novelty. But it would work _much_ better with a third-person camera, and a complete rethink of how to present information to a VR player. Most of the UI hovers in a flat plane in the "forward" direction, which sometimes becomes disaligned with the direction that combat is going in. It's got the exact 16:9 aspect ratio of a modern monitor, so this is clearly the screen edge UI of the flat view of the game. However, it's placed too close to feel comfortable and too far to the edges to be easily seen. A traditional RPG interface is difficult to design for VR; there are many different approaches and none of them are really satisfying, so it's a difficult problem to solve, but here it has also not been solved.

Probably okay in 2D except for the lack of subtitle configuration and possibly opening-scene weirdness (I don't know what's VR-specific and what's a general part of the program's behavior). I feel like this was a sloppy VR conversion and there's a lot of _potential_ here but the UI needs to be completely redesigned.
 
Kistaro
1,551 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2020
Old school in spirit but a very nice looking game. I loved the beautiful artwork and level design reasonably strategic combat and creative puzzles, The game is pretty linear which I didn't mind. There are few jokes here and there that are mostly funny and the game is long enough to feel finished but short enough to not get to repetitive, definite must have for anyone who remembers grid based games of the old days.

The only negative mention would be some puzzles (very few, not to spoil anything) that are quite annoying (if I wanted a puzzle game I'd get one) but the overall impression is still clearly positive.

Wuzaor
1,375 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
43.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2020
As a dungeon crawler, this game is quite interesting, and the VR option (which I haven´t tried) makes it even more so, mostly due to the puzzles and the secrets scattered all over the different levels that are not as unique as they could, but all of them paint an interesting picture.

Plot-wise, the game is clear, something has happened and the signs are telling you to go recover the Sun, the different characters form different stories that are connected. And in that regard, wanted to mention that this is one of the few games that explore Eastern Europe mythology making it extra interesting for those of us that know a bit but not enough.

Exploration-wise this game is a shiny gem, due to the full control of the camera, making the secrets hard but not impossible to spot exploring everything is usually welcome, and since there are no random encounters, exploration does not become a boring task.

Battle-wise the game is... unpolished. Initial levels are OK, but difficulty has many spikes that forced me to stop using the hunter MC since the damage output was not enough for the difficulty at the time, when the game keeps throwing you hp sponges in groups of 5 with not enough AoE in your team to counter or survive them. At the time I was a bit green regarding the game mechanics, so maybe it was my fault, but the Mage MC is just amazingly better.

Speaking of game mechanics, I do believe the game could use better or deeper explanations to help new players understand their skills/stats better.

Example of this lack of information is the way damage goes, every 10 points of the skill main stat (STR/AGI/INT) increase the damage of the skill, meaning that 27 STR is close to the same than 20. Another example would be that for archers, the melee weapons extra abilities (text in white underneath damage), are applied to long range attacks (and some of them even to spells (I am not 100% sure)).

Music is memorable and some areas have very soothing OST, cannot speak about graphics since my laptop can only run on minimum, but even if nothing was crazy impressive, it wasn´t cheap either.

If you like dungeon crawlers, this is a nice one, if you don´t, is still an interesting story, to enjoy as new players to the genre.
 
Clead HeavenHell
0

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
37.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2020
Это моя первая игра в таком жанре и сеттинге. Давно искал игру в которой можно расслабиться, легкий и приятный сюжет, отмечу, что местами очевидный, но это не делает игру хуже, это приятная очевидность, так сказать в каноне. Передвижение по локации в первые 15 минут игры для меня было безумием, не думал что так быстро привыкну и теперь мне это не сказать что нравится, но я считаю, что это приемлемо и отлично сочетается с сеттингом, боевка - именно то что надо, не нужна быстрая реакция и прочие навыки, красиво и аккуратно. в целом можно выделить много интересных моментов и решений, которых я не встречал ранее. Приятно удивлен и готов рекомендовать для приятного времяпрепровождения
 
TrES-4
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
41.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2020
Muy bueno. Bastante innovador en cuanto al movimiento teclado-ratón. Los gráficos recuerdan a borderlands pero sin las líneas negras tipo cómic. Los rompecabezas progresan en dificultad sin llegar a resultar frustrantes. Los combates son por turnos sin desplazamiento, eso puede no gustar a los amantes del frenesí, pero no se tarda en otorgar una dispensa acompañada de una sonrisa. Eso sí, el plantel de hechizos y habilidades no es muy extenso, pero están muy conseguidos que es lo importante. En otros juegos en los que hay muchos, uno siempre acaba utilizando los cuatro o cinco favoritos. En RV es muy divertido, superando al fabuloso Grimrock. La única nota negativa sería el precio, puesto que la cantidad de horas empleadas y recursos que requiere programar éste tipo de juego no lo justifica, pero esperad a que esté de oferta y... A por él sin dudarlo.
 
Metemor
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
18.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2020
Finally a classic turn-based RPG in VR. I love it. I really love this. I've been waiting for something like this since I first tried VR. I have nothing bad to say about it. It even seems longer than most VR content. I got through the first dungeon and it looks like I'm nowhere close to finished the game. It's great, because we need stuff you can play seated, relaxed and with a controller if you want. I want a hundred more games like this.

Anyone who gives this a bad review would give any classic turn-based game a bad review, because they're just one of those people who want action games or don't like the style of the classics. Finally a developer gets that we're not all the same so we can have some more variety in the types of game we can play. This is literally the first RPG I've played that's not an action RPG in VR after 5 years of owning a Rift and I'm not disappointed now. If you like classic turn-based RPGs, definitely get this. I hope we get a hundred more like it.

Umpahlumpa
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2020
Warm and Fuzzy!
This for me is like coming from the cold self-destructing world outside, and getting into a nice warm candlelit bath with a glass of mulled wine: A reminder of when games were simple, but well structured and interesting - and when life was too! Only now with updated graphics and man....VR!!!I never thought I would ever see the day when I could actually enter the game, and actually be in one of those old dungeon crawlers. I played through most of the game (on Epic Game Store,), and then bought it again on Steam and started from the top in VR. It is a whole new deal in VR - so immersive and so - well... enchanting (there is a word I almost forgot existed). The VR purists (of which I am, at times, one) will moan and bit-ch about lack of controller support (works just fine with a Xbox controller - get over it!), of the way the menus are not congruent with VR, How they should be able to crawl around in their VR den interacting with objects etc etc. Younger games, who were not brought up on Dungeon Master, and all though old grid based games, will not be able to re-imagine the magic of those games and will complain about the grid based movement.[one criticism that will be levelled, that I will agree with, is he lack of graphical options. Don't get me wrong, the game looks just fine - but not as sharp or detailed as the flat version, and I am sure my rig could squeeze out a little more fidelity.]But in a ♥♥♥♥♥ world, I am so grateful to slump back in a chair, leave it all behind and breathe a sigh of escapism. So, cast your preconceptions aside, immerse yourself and go with the flow - and you will get hours and hours of harmless escapism and joy from this. I am like a kid in a candy store with a big grin on his face - relieved of the burden of cynicism and criticism, I am free to just soak up and old school solid gaming experience, and old time story-telling in a whole new level of immersion. I love the game and love the studio for bringing this to me - it is (at this time) *just* what I want.(sorry for the lack of formatting - something weird on Steam side)
 
dunninger
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
29.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2020
Is this a game that could be the perfect purchase? Yes. Is it the perfect purchase? No. The game has amazing graphics. Perfect colours and characters that are ok. Music is a masterpiece. Great job too. But the game lacks of fair play. What do i mean. You are a great player and go smoothly into the game. You level up fairly good. You get extra moves and spells. If you have mana all is good. If you dont game nine over ten times wins. You wont stand a chance. Your basic attack gives 4 and 5 damage and the opponent gives four times more. In more advanced levels you will encounter enemies that stun you or frighten you. This means. You wont be able to move. Probably you wont be able to do anything from the first round. So, how do you recharge stamina? from camps. randomly placed in the maps. But is just only this? Nooooo, you must have find limited sticks or woods to rest, otherwise you must buy them. How many are there? 3 at most if you get them they spawn again whenever the game wants. So in the end you do crazy maths and economy to heal your mana and energy and still it wont be enough. What about the weapons armor and magical equipment. I am feeling sorry for the guy who designed those perfect swords and shields etc. Also the one who gave great names but the weapons and other stuff , especially those in the market are pretty useless. You are almost ending the game m and you get to fine a nice fancy sword. Is better than the one you have?? NOOO. So what is the point. This keeps happening in the most objects to be fair. not all. Saving is also a pain in the head. you can only save in the camps. Why?? Why?? and then there is an option save and exit? where will you begin next time? in the camp? in the place you exit? in space? where? I m seriously thinking of quiting the game and play something else.

Edit: i ve reached final boss. Totally inhuman. Bye.

Recommandé
14.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2020
This one was a tough yes. It is sort of a blobber, but it really works more like a puzzle game. You can only create one character of your party and then you get to pick and choose from others as the game goes on (This is to help drive the story, but I do like to build my groups). Monsters do not respawn. You can't grind and get any better; you will just move along the same monsters killed as everyone else. Items slightly differ, but they are hard to tell apart. When you FINALLY get to see a merchant, the items available are capped per area. So, we are left with some kinda cool mobs and some neat exploration, but eventually the puzzles get pretty obscure (or I missed clicking some pixel). I have decided to hang it up. It was fun for what it was worth; I just wish it had more encounters and skills.
 
Corpselocker
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2020
As of the making of this review, I am still to fully finish the game.

It's quite enjoyable, the art style is nice, the lore is a welcome change from the standard Norse or Greek affairs that are so common. As mentioned by others the game has lots of dialogue and the VA's range from great to not bad but not good either.

As also remarked by others the combat "skills" are few in number and lack depth, but for a game of this length and where battle is more of a means to an end rather than the main attraction I think its as deep as it needs to be.

The last thing to be noted about this game is the reasonable business approach, a demo and not falling into the trap of standard pricing for games makes this game a steal and earns it considerable good will.

TL;DR Fun game, shallow combat but not detrimentally so, voice acting ranging from great to so-so, interesting lore and setting that's not the standard template and Jóska best boy.
 
The Anathema
239 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
39.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2020
POSITIVES:
- A modern twist on some of some of my favorite 80's / 90's first-person, grid-based RPG's like Might and Magic.

- Great writing. You really get to care for the characters and get a feel for them without it distracting from gameplay for too long. I feel like they have struck a great balance of dialogue versus actually playing the damn game. There are some pretty funny moments and characters tease each other like you'd expect of companions journeying together. There are no Mary Sue characters I've seen so far. One character in particular gets called out on a very immoral decision they had made, but it's handled the way I could believe human beings would react (not over-the-top or indifferent).

- They employ some very subtle ways of avoiding breaking the fourth wall. Where most games just say "Press J to open your journal", in Operencia it is explained that one of your companions is writing those journal entries. It's even written from that character's perspective with their mannerisms and sense of humor. Little things like that just add to immersion of the game and make you feel like the developers put their love into the game.

- Lots of puzzles and secrets to find which are mostly pretty clever and satisfying when you figure them out. I really like that the difficulty has multiple dimensions that affect gameplay rather than just a single slider. I'm currently playing my first playthrough with all difficulty settings set to normal except combat, which I set to hard. Beyond a few encounters where the difficulty spikes unexpectedly, it feels just right for my first run.

NEGATIVES:
- Despite there being an entire screen on your character sheet with quite a few stats which seem straightforward, there still seems to be some math going on behind the scenes that you can't really quantify. For example, you are told intelligence makes your spells more powerful but the game gives you no way to quantify this (it just shows you some of the related stats that are increased like critical damage / change, energy, etc). There are three numbers for physical power, defense, and magic power, but it isn't explained whether these numbers are actually being used for calculations or if they are just a way to summarize your stats. There are definitely items which read like they should make your spells more powerful, but the magic power number is lower than another item which would seem like it should be more defensive.

- Some mechanics could use more explanation (or just be explained earlier). The ability types (Sun, Wind, Moon, Star?, Some temple looking thing?) are little icons in the ability descriptions, but it didn't really make that point very clear. These fill up these party abilities which you start getting before the game even tells you about them. I figured out they were there about an hour before the game bothered telling me "Oh, yeah, there's this thing down here that you've been using for a while already, but I waited until now to actually tell you about it."

- Large enemies (pretty much every boss) don't fit on the screen if you are using an ultrawide (21:9) monitor. It doesn't interfere with your ability to target them, but there is some helpful information that appears above enemies that just gets chopped off when they are too tall. I just pretend it's an extra level of difficulty that I can't see bosses' remaining health and it hasn't bothered me too much. This is so far the only thing I've seen that doesn't work as intended on 21:9 aspect ratio, so it's definitely handled better than a lot of other games I've played at least.

- Despite the dialogue being well written, some of the voice actors are very uninspiring at times. Some of the characters have consistently great voice work. Some of them have their ups and downs. One particular character is just annoying to listen to and sounds like someone trying to role play a goblin in their first ever game of D&D. It's still way better than anything Bethesda has ever put out, so I wouldn't let this affect your purchasing decision.

OVERALL:
Fantastic game! I'd give it an 84%.
 
Bun Bo
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
73.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2020
Ursprünglich bereits Ende 2018 exklusiv auf Epic erschien dieses RPG. Es ist wie The Bards Tale 4 eine Hommage an die „guten“ alten Dungeon Crawler. Feldweise bewegt man sich mit seiner Party über die Karte, löst Rätsel, bekämpft Gegner und folgt der Geschichte. Diese ist auch wirklcih schön erzahlt. Auser der Perspektive des Diebes Joschka, der ständiger Begleiter der Party ist, aber nicht das AlterEgo darstellt. Joschka erzählt in teilweise recht humorvollen Monologen von sich und der Welt. Ungfragt plappert er Kommentare zu Feinden oder Rätsel aus. Das passt! Auch das Genretypische Jorunall ist übersichtlich und gut beschrieben. Ich hatte tatsächlich Freude daran hier und da zu gucken, was über Feinde, Hintergrundgeschichte und Rätsel dort geschrieben wurde! Das ist für mich eher ungewöhnlich. Die Texte sind nicht wirklich tiefgründig und detailliert, aber gut und einfach zu lesen! Die Prise Humor tut auch hier gut. Das Kampfsystem ist anfangs nicht wirklich herausfordernd wird aber mit zunehmender Spieldauer schwieriger. Der Endgegner des letzten Levels hat mich dann auch wirklich 10 Anläufe gekostet. Das war fast schon etwas nervtötend. Die meisten Rätsel sind sehr schön gestaltet. Die Designer haben sich hier viel Mühe gegeben. Fast alle Rätsel sind für mich lösbar gewesen, bei Dreien war der Blick in einen Walkthrough notwendig. Bei einem Rätsel (ebenfalls letzter Level) hätte ich noch 5 Stunden herumrennen können und wäre nicht auf die Lösung gekommen. Das Spiel hat mir hier keine Hinweise gegeben. In Summa sind die vielen guten Rätsel aber ein deutlicher Pluspunkt und wesentlich besser gestaltet als bei Bards Tale 4. Positiv herausheben möchte ich das craften von Tränken. Auch hier gilt es kleine Texträtsel zu lösen und fest vorgegebene Ingredenzien in der richtigen Reihenfolge zuführen. Herrlich! Das Spiel hat schön gezeichnete Zwischensequenzen und auch eine ansprechende Grafik. Allerdings sollte man hier kein High End erwarten. Die Animationen sind gelungen aber nicht besonders abwechslungsreich. Das tut dem Spielspaß aber keinen Abbruch. So mancher Glanzeffekt sieht sogar recht schön aus. Die Musik ist angenehm unaufdringlich und passend. Die Vertonung im allgemeinen und die englischen Sprecher ebenfalls. Fehler oder Bugs sind mir, bis auf einen einzigen, nicht weiter aufgefallen. Das mag daran liegen, dass es bereits sein einem Jahr erhältlich im Epic Store ist. Mir hat das Spiel wirklich gut gefallen und ich kann es vor allem Leuten empfehlen, die schon immer einen Dungeon Crawler spielen wollten und auch denen die WIEDER mal wieder einen Dungeon Crawler spielen wollten.
 
Biberattacke
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
58.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2020
Absolut großartiges Spiel mit ungewöhnlicher Story und Setting basierend auf ungarischen Volksmärchen und Mythologie. Ich war auf der Suche nach einem Spiel, das so ähnlich wie Legend of Grimrock ist und ich bin wirklich begeistert, weil ich so eine hohe Qualität gar nicht erwartet hatte. Hatte mit dem Spiel mindestens genauso viel Spaß wie mit LoG!

Im Kern ist es ein old-school Dungeon-Crawler allerdings mit freier Kamera, so dass man schnell vergisst, dass man sich eigentlich nur kachelförmig fortbewegt. Die Grafik ist super-schick und hat einen fabel-/märchenhaften Look. Am Skillsystem finde ich toll, dass es nicht unnötig komplex ist, sondern sich aufs Wesentliche konzentriert. Trotzdem ist es sehr variabel, so dass man ständig überlegt, was man noch ausprobieren und optimieren könnte.

Die Level sind ein ganz großes Highlight. Operencia hat ein ganz eigenes Art-Design mit 12 abwechslungsreichen Leveln. Mal erkundet man ganz klassisch ein düsteres Dungeon oder Grab, mal erklimmt man einen Weltenbaum, dann findet man sich in einem Wald wieder, in dem alles aus Kupfer besteht... Schön auch, das immer wieder Rätsel eingebaut sind, die meiner Meinung nach genau den richtigen Schwierigkeitsgrad haben. Sie unterfordern einen nicht, sind aber auch nicht unnötig komplex. Wenn man kurz drüber nachdenkt, kommt man eigentlich immer drauf.

Genial ist auch der Humor - fast jeder Itemtext ist ein Lacher, die Charaktere der Party ziehen sich ständig gegenseitig auf und auch viele Questbeschreibungen sind ein Brüller. Das Spiel nimmt sich nicht wirklich ernst, nimmt dafür gerne mal RPG-Klischees aufs Korn.

Fazit: Wer ein kurzweiliges Dungeon-Crawler-RPG in einem interessanten Setting sucht wird mit Operencia viel Spaß haben. Die Spielzeit ist ordentlich bemessen: Ich habe in jedem der 12 Level 3-4 Stunden verbracht, bis ich jedes Geheimnis gelüftet und jeden Schatz gehoben hatte.
 
RobinSword

Fairly nice game. Well thought-out, very few bugs, and pretty smooth to play.

My one major gripe is that the narrator (Elia) gets FAR TOO QUIET! Sometimes it's okay because her words are on the screen. Other times, forget it! You can't understand what she's saying without turning your sound way up. And by the time you do, it's too late! And when you do turn it up to hear her, and a different character suddenly talks, you'll be blown away by the volume of their voice!

terra
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
29.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2020
Very good indie dungeon crawler.

Graphics are nice where it counts (in the game), comparable with Grimrock 2. Cutscenes are hand-drawn well enough. I only found the loading screens very bare-bones (Times New Roman-like font, no borders around the text elements. I think this is something the devs could easily fix and which would give the whole game a more cohesive and less amateurish look (which it deserves).

Sounds and music are well done, as well as the voice acting. I also like the fresh setting based on Hungarian folklore, even though I found the story itself rather mediocre.

Gameplay is excellent, striking a nice balance between combat, exploration, puzzles and party management. Some new ideas in here, which I really appreciated: I like the "logic puzzle potion crafting" a lot, as well as the fact that you can re-skill and re-distribute attribute points for characters at any time. Game also has a metroidvania-feel to it, as you can return to earlier levels to access secrets with new abilities.

I'd say price should be a tad (~5 $/€) lower but even at the current level, you get good value for your money. All in all, strongly recommended for fans of - and vastly superior to - Bard's Tale IV (DC) or Might & Magic X.
 
khamsun
2,967 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 avril 2020
Great world building

Bought the game on the day it came out on Steam, played it for 45 hours with two hard difficulty settings on. I had a great time!

The game looks beautiful. Turn based combat feels solid, and paced well and responsive. Music is also not bad. Story is intriguing and interesting. Artifact system (puzzle solving mechanic) is brilliant and flavourful.


A few things I didn't like about the game...
Some puzzles and secrets are not so well made, not very clear or not enough clue, although I managed to find most of the secrets in the game.
Sometimes voice overs are not easy to understand with gigantic hall reverb effect. And, some sound effects in combat are too loud, not well balanced.
I got 3D motion sickness partly because the camera movement is always stuck with the mouse movement, unlike other games such as Legend of Grimrock in which you need to hold your mouse button down to look around. However, this free camera movement does make the grid based world much smoother and thus the game almost feels as if it isn't based on the grid.
Very bad Japanese localization, sadly. I turned the Japanese subtitle on for the first level, couldn't bare with Google translate copy and paste.


I would say it is a buy if you are a fan of the genre. 7.5/10
Looking forward to the sequel.
 
Cosay

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
42.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2020
Wonderful game!
I have been playing this type of RPG for 30 years, Dungeon Master, Captive, Knightmare... the recent Legends of Grimrock 1/2, Vaporeum and many more.

Operencia is a pure gem!

The mouse-controlled camera is absolutely fantastic. Sometimes you forget is a "grid game".. feels right.
The combat system turn-based is against the classic concept of this kind of games, but solve the problem of the "grid dance". It is nice, can be improved, but it is very nice.
The classes leaves you many spec choices. There is not a single perfect party. You can mix the party in many ways:
Party composition, class spec, equipment
And the characters you don't choose for your party still follow you and participate in the cutscenes...

The cutscenes!! What a wonderful job they made!
They are well made, hilarious, engaging! Outside and inside the combat. The cutscenes dispel the sense of loneliness that these games always have.

I have finished the game with 100% achievements on the first run (No autosaves, No map, Hard mode)
My main party was (characters names spoilers):

Mage (Fire/Ice)
Csilla (Heals/Thunders)
Mezey (Tank/Support)
Kela (DPS/Summoner)

Seriously, buy it :D

Évaluation publiée le 4 avril 2020
Das Spiel macht sehr viel Spaß, die Rätsel sind zwar nicht die schwersten aber auch nicht so, dass einem langweilig werden würde. Die Spielwelt ist wunderschön gestaltet, so dass die Atmosphäre gut wirken kann.
Alles in Allem ein schönes Spiel für zwischendurch.

48.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2020
An entertaining, old school grid based dungeon crawler set in beautifully crafted, evocative environments. The graphics and music are impressively coherent and create a great atmosphere. The devs and artists did justice to the Central European mythological setting, there's just enough lore that it doesn't become a lecture. The characters are fully and well voiced and chatter quite a lot. Controls are straightforward, movement feels very fluid and free despite being grid based. Gameplay is linear, I haven't encountered any side quests yet, and the puzzles so far are very simple. However this gives you a constant sense of progress, every action advances the story. Combat is turn based and well balanced, most enemies feel challenging just enough to be interesting.
 
leiric

Recommandé
15.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2020
Ich war lange auf der Suche nach einem Stimmungsvollen Dungeon-Crawler wie es Anvil of Dawn zu seiner Zeit war.... und ich bin fündig geworden.

+ klassisches Dungeoncrawling
Kachelweise Fortbewegung ist dank der flüssigen Grafik ein der freien Perspektive mit der Maus nicht anstrengend oder lästig

+ solides Kampfsystem
Kurz an die gewöhnungsbedürftigen Symbole gewöhnt und schon geht es los. Dank guten und kurzem Tutorial kein Problem. Schwierigkeit kann eingestellt werden und fordert etwas taktisches Geschick bei schwerer Kampfeinstellung - aber alles machbar.

+Stimmungsvolle Umsetzung
Dank brillanter Grafik und voll vertonter (derzeit nur englisch) Charaktere die ihre Rollen ganz klassisch vertreten, bietet ein erfrischend bodenständiger Humor für Abwechslung und macht Lust auf mehr. Die Charaktere sind wirklich charaktertechnisch gut gezeichnet.

- Kleiner Skillbaum
Jeder Charakter scheint einen eigenen Skillbaum zu haben und selbst gleiche Charakterklasse unterscheiden sich zwischen den Charakteren. Dennoch ist wenig Auswahl und man hat kein großen Spielmöglichkeiten. Dennoch ausreichend für den Rollenspielflair - für richtige Rollenspieler wohl etwas zu dünn im Detailgrad.

- keine deutsche Sprachausgabe
Trotz fehlender deutscher Sprachausgabe ist der Dialog per Untertext nachvollziehbar und kann im Journal nachgelesen werden. Die Sprecher sind recht schnell wenn man selbst ein langsamer/fauler Leser ist wie ich - aber der Umfang ist selbst für Lesemuffel geeignet.

Fazit: Der Kauf ist bei dem Preis durchaus zu empfehlen.
 
Wip

Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2020
This is an incredibly charming little game that seemed to come out of nowhere, and it's been making me really happy. I grew up playing the Wizardry and D&D dungeon games of old, and right away what caught my eye about Operencia is the ways that it tries to set itself apart, while still maintaining that oldschool vibe. Dungeon games tend to be about exploration first, character progression second, and story a distant, distant third. While this is a "dungeon crawler" in the most literal sense, right from the get-go the game distinguishes itself by introducing a rich mythology and narrative, which does a great job of setting the tone. This is a very story-driven game, with the campfire being a prime storytelling device, which really helps to add context. Another thing setting the game apart is the constant witty banter between you and your party members, which is really refreshing. Lastly, the art is absolutely gorgeous, and what they've done with the visuals is really impressive. Things up close are rendered in great detail and texture, but anything farther away becomes progressively "storybook" like, like an illustration in an old book of fairy tales, which is definitely intentional. As you're moving, objects and scenery gain more and more detail, and the transition is almost seamless.

So far I've been very impressed with this game, and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys oldschool RPG's, but with a modern twist
 
Whiskeyjoel

Very Fun and Strategic game with many secrets and exploration opportunities. I only wish that it was more clear what attributes did what and which skills scale off of which attributes, I was 75% through the game before I realized.

0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

In this video I take a look at Operencia: The Stolen Sun, a turn based RPG game.

Initially it was a little disappointing to have such a great graphical environment with free look via your mouse but a classic RPG movement system that only allows you to move via a grid system forward, backwards, left or right. But this is the type of game it is supposed to be and the great graphics and the free look are just a bonus so I quickly decided to enjoy it for what it's meant to be, a modern take on these classic RPG titles. In that genre it appears to excel, with a great story, graphics, and strategic turn based combat. I played the opening sequence in the video and had a great time. The opening sequence has you playing the King and Queen for an epilogue so you are very powerful and take out enemies easily so you can learn the ropes but once it's over you create your own character and start the game as a weak beginner stuck in a cell. I had to end the video there because it was getting too long but it was really getting into a good story.
I think this game is very well made with fantastic production quality so if you’re into RPG's you might want to check it out.

Watch the video to see what the game is like...
